definitions.text: being on the outside or further from a center
examples: spent hours adorning the outer man

definitions.text: being on or toward the outside of the body
not allowed to continue to bat or run
examples: he was tagged out at second on a close play

definitions.text: being out or having grown cold
examples: threw his extinct cigarette into the stream

definitions.text: not worth considering as a possibility
examples: a picnic is out because of the weather

definitions.text: out of power; especially having been unsuccessful in an election

examples: in our house dancing and playing cards were out

definitions.text: directed outward or serving to direct something outward

examples: that style is out these days
the out surface of a ship's hull

definitions.text: knocked unconscious by a heavy blow
